properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Town Of Gravelbourg
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Town of Gravelbourg. This advisory is for the entire community and any individuals who may access water from the Gravelbourg water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-05-08T16:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-01T11:15:03-06:00, AE3E974E-265D-BF01-6A19-34E1827995F6
Area: Town of Gravelbourg
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A significant rainfall will continue tonight. Rain will continue tonight before tapering to scattered showers early Friday. Total rainfall amounts near 40 mm are possible. Ponding of water is possible on roads as the rain continues to fall. Caution is advised near rivers, creeks and culverts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-01T17:59:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-01T03:08:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0444535179.2020
Area: Belleville - Quinte West - Eastern Northumberland County, Stirling - Tweed - Madoc, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Gananoque - Mallorytown, Kaladar - Bannockburn - Bon Echo Park, Smiths Falls - Perth - Eastern Lanark County, Plevna - Sharbot Lake - Western Lanark County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall is expected. Total rainfall: 30 to 50 mm. Locally higher amounts possible. Locations: Port-aux-Basques and vicinity and the Connaigre Peninsula. Time span: overnight tonight until Sunday morning. Remarks: Additional rainfall amounts will be added for Saturday night in subsequent forecasts. The highest rainfall amounts are currently expected to be in the Burgeo - Ramea area where a rainfall warning is already in effect. Should the higher amounts extend into these adjacent regions the rainfall warning may need to be expanded. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-02T05:14:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-01T13:15:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2746278288.2020
Area: Connaigre, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continued For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca. Follow @MBGov and @MBGovRoads on Twitter or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2020-05-02T18:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-04-30T15:23:44-05:00, 83E06D1E-8D49-8CA9-58A5-8FCCC7FAC8FE
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway Inlet Control Structure
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Cancelled - A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Is Being Issued For The Village Of Loreburn.
properties.Summary:
Description: Cancelled - A precautionary drinking water advisory has been cancelled for the Village of Loreburn. The test results came back clear and the water is safe to drink again.
Expires: 2020-05-01T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Loreburn and Strongfield, 2020-05-01T11:47:42-06:00, 4F41B1B8-818C-0A38-7497-221F079AC446
Area: Village of Loreburn
properties.Author: SK Loreburn and Strongfield

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected overnight into Saturday morning. A low pressure system approaching the area will bring a mix of rain, snow and freezing rain to the area beginning this evening. Precipitation is expected to begin as rain and then transition to freezing rain or snow for some areas as temperatures fall to near or slightly below the freezing mark. Freezing rain may persist for several hours before changing to snow or rain Friday morning. At this time there is some uncertainty in the exact location of the heaviest freezing rain. Freezing rain warnings may be required as the situation becomes more certain. Rain or snow will continue Saturday before changing to snow later Saturday afternoon or evening. Total snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-02T08:42:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-01T16:43:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1537720091.2020
Area: Sachigo Lake - Bearskin Lake, Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain today and tonight followed by heavy snow on Saturday. A low pressure system approaching from Saskatchewan will spread an area of rain through central and southern Manitoba today. As this system moves into Ontario overnight, an additional swath of rain will fall over central areas before transition to snow early Saturday morning. For the community of Norway House and surrounding area, rain will begin this morning and intensify this afternoon and evening with total rainfall amounts reaching 30 to 50 mm over the next 24 hours. As cold air moves south overnight, the rain will transition to snow and continue on Saturday. Total snowfall accumulations are still highly variable at this time but it is possible that greater than 15 cm of snow will fall in the region. Snowfall warnings may be issued at a later time. In the Island Lake region, rain will begin later this afternoon and intensify in the evening bringing total rainfall amounts of 15 to 25 mm. As cold air moves south overnight, an area of freezing rain develops near the communities of Oxford House and Gods Lake and eventually into Island Lake by morning. The rain and freezing rain then transitions to snow in the morning. Total snowfall accumulations are still highly variable at this time but it is possible that greater than 15 cm of snow will fall in the region. Freezing rain and/or snowfall warnings may be issued at a later time. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-02T01:15:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-01T09:16:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0670195448.2020
Area: Molson Lake and Bear Lake, Cross Lake and Jenpeg, Wabowden, Hwy 6 between Little Limestone Lake and Ponton, Norway House, Oxford House and Gods Lake, Red Sucker Lake, Island Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada
